content.description:
Is this route any good?  Connect the pockets to find out (hint: it is). 

  This route gets a lot of use.
content.protection: Plenty of bolts and trees to build an anchor with.  You can also top rope on the chains - just be polite and add your own biners to the end.
content.location: Follow the trail from the parking lot down the stairs and to the left.  Enter the big main canyon and its the second route (after the arete) on the face to your right.  If there are plenty of pockets filled with daddy long leg spiders, you're in the right place.

content.description: Starts on a small shelf under the tall overhang - directly across and to the right of the tall tree. Kinda fun, gets juggy at the top.

Some of the longer climbs in the park.  The wall is solid 5.8 - 5.9 territory with suprisingly aestethic climbing.  Just be sure the first person up isn't afraid of spiders... 

  All climbs have bolt anchors at the top, and there are chains near the north east corner for rapelling if you aren't comfortable downclimbing the approach. 

  This wall is shaded the entire day, which is why there will almost always be a few climbers on this wall when it's hot out.
